Title: libXpm: Remote execution of arbitrary code
Synopsis:
An integer overflow in libXpm might allow remote attackers to
    execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service Condition.

Background.Text: The X PixMap image format is an extension of the monochrome X BitMap format specified in the X protocol, and is commonly used in traditional X applications.

Description.Text: An integer overflow was discovered in libXpmâ€™s src/CrDatFrI.c file. On 64 bit systems, this allows an overflow to occur on 32 bit integers while parsing XPM extensions in a file.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker, by enticing a user to process a specially crafted XPM file, could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.
